An intern left half the RSA private key on a sticky note. Can you recover the message? The encrypted flag is: 3379266087547663839581836789071202303876328540530270845583209096045296737192647439116170326156466408948192979502987816630286002294820079232818593697934215

The flag format is flag{...}
n=10486515752840315517151825668877642998538066170580497852073885205142613159249748704398289723051066084721583553972455440720734697804946153133799399673577333, e=4977499213886991666462196373484393356923104804705178167744067705312244743653332262072129143647183569274404595366018625378103566144317942560577781615751093, partial_p=16208646373216608638

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{35wv4osr}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 3379266087547663839581836789071202303876328540530270845583209096045296737192647439116170326156466408948192979502987816630286002294820079232818593697934215
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10486515752840315517151825668877642998538066170580497852073885205142613159249748704398289723051066084721583553972455440720734697804946153133799399673577333, e=4977499213886991666462196373484393356923104804705178167744067705312244743653332262072129143647183569274404595366018625378103566144317942560577781615751093, partial_p=16208646373216608638
